What are horoscopes astronomically?

One's horoscope depends on the constellation which astronomical bodies appear to lie in front of from Earth's point of reference. This is why you may hear people say that their “sun is in Leo” or “Mercury is in Virgo.” Most generally, when someone asks about your "sign," they are asking for your sun sign, or what is thought to be the constellation which the sun lies in front of when you are born.

Why does the sun appear to be in the wrong zodiac sign for my birthday?

The horoscopes and zodiac signs used in the U.S and the western hemisphere are no longer tied to the stars, and are instead related to the seasons and months due to precession. This type is called tropical, while the form of astrology based on the position of the astronomical bodies is called “sidereal,” and this is what our program will show you. You can learn more about this in detail on our Info page.
